comment.author: 16830149@N02
comment._content: From CWCG Name: ODAM, JOHN W. Initials: J W Nationality: United Kingdom Rank: Company Serjeant Major Regiment/Service: Middlesex Regiment Unit Text: 21st Bn. Age: 24 Date of Death: 23/03/1918 Service No: G/15410 Additional information: Son of Alfred and Elizabeth Odam, of 18, Northampton St., Canonbury, London. Casualty Type: Commonwealth War Dead Grave/Memorial Reference: Bay 7. Memorial: ARRAS MEMORIAL

comment.author: 63191264@N00
comment._content:
John William Odam, born about 1894 Islington, London. The 1901 census records him living with his parents  Alfred Baxter Odam [b.1869 d.1914] and Elizabeth Caroline nee Olive [b.1866 d.1935] and along with his brothers Alfred J [b.1892], George S [b.1899], Frank L [b.1900] and sister Lily M O [b.1897]. His father is employed as a Domestic Coachman.
The  1911 census record the family living at 18 Northampton Street, Islington with another son [born since the 1901 census] Edward [b1908].
His father is now employed as a Metal Burnisher. His older brother, Alfred is a Confidential Clerk & Shorthand Typist. His younger brother, George is a School Doctors Errand Boy. His sister, Lily, is a Dress Finisher. John himself is employed as a Gas & Hot Water Fitters Mate.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: freeBMD John William Odam registry of birth  2nd qr 1894  Islington 1b342
